moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 dxc4 3. e4 Nf6 4. Nc3 c6: For annotations for this first part (which I won't annotate in this annotation), see gameknot.com/annotation.pl/chess-game-part-1?gm=50218.
moves.17... c5: ?! He missed the crucial zwichenzug of trading queens first.  Now he doesn't have a second chance.
moves.19... c4: ?!  This positional error lead to a collapse on the queenside.
moves.20... Nf6: The knight can head to d-5, but it should take a role in defending the queenside.
moves.23... Ng4: ?  Loses a crucial tempo and the game.
moves.24. h3 Nh2: Now White can play the move.
moves.25. axb5 axb5: The pin will win a bishop.
moves.28. Ra3xa5 Rxa5 29. Rxa5: White is clearly ahead now.  The rest is elementary.
He probably overlooked this, but he is dead lost.
moves.34. Ra8#: Well, that's the game.  If you haven't seen the first annotation, take a look at the website near the top of the first page.
